title: Llanrhystud to Aberaeron Coastal Path Walking Route

nearby.description: New Quay to Aberaeron Coastal Path

images.title: John Fielding / Llanrhystud
images.caption: Llanrhystud, Ceredigion. Village and church from the bridleway to Castell-bach. In the village the rivers Carrog, Wyre and Wyre Fach meet before flowing into the sea.

images.title: The beach at Llanrhystud by Eirian Evans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The beach at Llanrhystud. It's a fine windsurfing beach with a panoramic view of Cardigan Bay.

images.title: Bjenks, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Llansantffraed Church

images.title: The Ceredigion Coastal Path just south of Llanrhystud by Eirian Evans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Ceredigion Coastal Path just south of Llanrhystud

images.title: The river Peris reaching the beach at Llansantffraed by Eirian Evans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The river Peris reaching the beach at Llansantffraed

images.title: On the Ceredigion Coast Path, north-east of Aberarth by David Purchase, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: On the Ceredigion Coast Path, north-east of Aberarth

images.title: OLU, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sea Defences at Aberarth. Aberarth once had a thriving ship-building industry.

images.title: Stephen McKay / North Beach, Aberaeron
images.caption: North Beach, Aberaeron. Looking firstly towards the small car park at the end of Tabernacle Street and beyond that the harbour mouth. This was a bank holiday Monday, but the strong and very cold wind ensured there were very few people about.

description: This walk follows a section of the Ceredigion Coast Path and the Wales coast path from the little village of Llanrhystud to the town of Aberaeron. The route runs for a distance of about 8 miles, following a fairly flat path with a moderate climb on the way. You will also pass the villages of Llansantffraid, Llanon and Aberarth and the remnants of a medieval field strip section known as Morfa Esgob. At the end of the route you can pick up the popular Aberaeron to Llanerchaeron Walk which will take you to a lovely National Trust owned Georgian villa.
display_address: Heol Marged, Llanrhystyd, Llanrhystud, Ceredigion, Cymru / Wales, SY23 5DQ, United Kingdom
